page.title: 14Arleston
page.content: The village of Arleston lies to the S.E. of Wellington, separated from it by the old Roman Road Watling Street, now the B5061.The village is made up of a large estate of council houses with a small complex of private houses to the E.,divided from neighbouring Ketley by the A518 trunk road.The oldest part of Arleston is the hamlet to the S.of the village,a scattered group of largely timber-framed cottages,and a large house known today as Arleston Manor. According to local tradition Arleston Manor was built as a hunting lodge for King James I.The timber-framed house has gables bearing the dates 1614 and 1630. The house required intensive renovation in 1978 due,it was felt,to the construction of the M54,which separates the manor from the farmland which rises to the immediate S.of Arleston.
